newsitem.title: USA: Broadway/Seymour holder to oppose actions.
newsitem.headline: Broadway/Seymour holder to oppose actions.

text.p: Broadway and Seymour Inc said on Wednesday a shareholder filed a Schedule 13D with with U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission stating it now owned 5.03 percent of the company's shares and intended to oppose several current management initiatives.

Shareholder Okabena Partnership K said it began buying shares in July 1996 and held 54,065 shares on the July 29 record date for an upcoming September 16 shareholder meeting, Broadway and Seymour said in a statement.
Broadway & Seymour President and Chief Executive Officer Alan Stanford said in a statement he would welcome a meeting with Okabena to discuss management strategy.

"As we have continually demonstrated, we are eager to meet with current or prospective investors to discuss our plans and progress and we welcome a visit from Okabena Partnership and any others as schedules can be arranged," Stanford said.

Stanford added: "With a priority on our customer and financial solutions group and Elite, the sale of major and minor non-core business units, and no acquisitions since the first of the year, Broadway & Seymour is well into the transition to its desired position as a software and services solutions company."
The shares owned by Okabena represented 0.6 of the 8,974,266 shares eligible for voting, the company said.
